column4: Anyone familiar with writing audio drivers/ probing audio hardware with HDAAnalyzer?
I wish I was.  then I would fix my sound/vid issues.
it's well documented in the forums.  I just can't find an acceptable solution. digitalstimulus: that's because i wrote it.
it's an ICH9, (unsupported hardware by alsa)
ah... that's a kernel problem, not an ubuntu problem.  if realtek would only release linux drivers we would all be happy.
I was told I could use hda-analyzer  to probe the codec and find the speaker, problem is, I have almost no idea which pin to enable.
does hda-analyser have a man page?  look for the contact details of the dev at the bottom.
also in ##hardware just in case anyone there knew
quoting the readme  "This Source Code is from www.alsa-project.org."
got a link to the driver?
so it looks like I already may have had it installed
